message.content: {"responses": [{"question_id": "TT4G35A", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers write or improve lesson plans.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35B", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35C", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence assists teachers in supporting students individually.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35D", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence supports students with specific needs (e.g. multilingual learners, students with special education needs).", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35E", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers automate administrative tasks.", "response": "Strongly agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35F", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35G", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35H", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35I", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence jeopardises the privacy and security of student data.", "response": "Strongly agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35J", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches that teachers would use with students.", "response": "Agree"}]}
message.reasoning_content:
The user is asking me to respond to a survey about AI in education from the perspective of a primary or secondary school teacher from Kosovo. I need to provide responses to each of the 10 statements using the response options: 'Strongly disagree', 'Disagree', 'Agree', 'Strongly agree', 'I don't know'.

Let me think about reasonable responses for a teacher from Kosovo considering current AI capabilities and challenges in education:

TT4G35A: "Artificial intelligence helps teachers write or improve lesson plans." - This is generally true, AI tools like ChatGPT can help generate lesson plans. I'd say "Agree"

TT4G35B: "Artificial intelligence enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities." - AI can support differentiation. I'd say "Agree"

TT4G35C: "Artificial intelligence assists teachers in supporting students individually." - AI can provide personalized support. I'd say "Agree"

TT4G35D: "Artificial intelligence supports students with specific needs (e.g. multilingual learners, students with special education needs)." - AI can help with accessibility and multilingual support. I'd say "Agree"

TT4G35E: "Artificial intelligence helps teachers automate administrative tasks." - This is definitely true, many AI tools can help with grading, scheduling, etc. I'd say "Strongly agree"

TT4G35F: "Artificial intelligence enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own." - This is a real concern with AI tools. I'd say "Agree"

TT4G35G: "Artificial intelligence makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct." - AI can make errors and inappropriate suggestions. I'd say "Agree"

TT4G35H: "Artificial intelligence amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions." - This is a known issue with AI. I'd say "Agree"

TT4G35I: "Artificial intelligence jeopardises the privacy and security of student data." - Data privacy is a real concern with AI systems. 

For the last two items, data security is a significant worry, so I'd respond "Strongly agree" there. TT4G35J about unsuitable pedagogical approaches is also concerning—AI might recommend methods that don't align with sound teaching practices, so "Agree" fits. Now I'll compile these responses for the function call.
